events.originalText: Michael Brown, an 18-year-old African-American man, was killed by a white police officer in Ferguson, Missouri, resulting in widespread protests and unrest.
events.subtitle: Killing of Michael Brown
events.headline: Michael Brown Killed by White Police Officer in Ferguson, Missouri

events.originalText: A civilian school bus in Dahyan, Yemen, was bombed by Saudi Arabia killing at least 40 children under 15.
events.subtitle: Dahyan
events.headline: Saudi Arabia Bombs School Bus in Dahyan, Yemen, Killing 40 Children

events.originalText: British police arrested 24 people for conspiring to detonate liquid explosives carried on board airliners travelling from the UK to the US and Canada.
events.subtitle: 2006 transatlantic aircraft plot
events.headline: 24 Arrested in UK for Conspiring to Detonate Liquid Explosives on Airliners

events.originalText: A suicide bomber attacked a pizza restaurant in Jerusalem, killing 15 people and wounding 130 others.
events.subtitle: Sbarro restaurant suicide bombing
events.headline: Suicide Bomber Kills 15 at Pizza Restaurant in Jerusalem

events.originalText: Wayne Gretzky was traded from the Edmonton Oilers to the Los Angeles Kings in one of the most controversial player transactions in ice hockey history.
events.subtitle: Wayne Gretzky
events.headline: Wayne Gretzky Traded to Los Angeles Kings from Edmonton Oilers

events.originalText: On the verge of an impeachment and removal from office amidst the Watergate scandal, Richard Nixon became the first president of the United States to resign his office.
events.subtitle: Impeachment process against Richard Nixon
events.headline: Richard Nixon Resigns Amidst Watergate Scandal

events.originalText: The Troubles: British forces began arresting and interning suspected Irish republican militants in Northern Ireland.
events.subtitle: The Troubles
events.headline: British Forces Arrest Irish Republican Militants in Northern Ireland

events.originalText: Members of the Manson Family invaded a house and murdered actress Sharon Tate and four guests, before killing two more people the following night.
events.subtitle: Manson Family
events.headline: Manson Family Murders Actress Sharon Tate and Four Guests

events.originalText: Members of the Manson Family invaded a house and murdered American actress Sharon Tate (pictured) and four guests in Los Angeles, before killing two more people the following night.
events.subtitle: Manson Family
events.headline: Manson Family Murders Actress Sharon Tate in Los Angeles

events.originalText: The state of Singapore (flag pictured) was expelled from the Malaysian federation due to a heated ideological conflict between their respective ruling parties.
events.subtitle: Singapore
events.headline: Singapore Expelled from Malaysian Federation

events.originalText: Led by Albert Kalonji, South Kasai declared its unilateral secession from the Republic of the Congo (Léopoldville).
events.subtitle: Albert Kalonji
events.headline: South Kasai Declares Unilateral Secession from Republic of the Congo

events.originalText: An estimated 20,000 women marched on Pretoria, South Africa, to protest the introduction of the Apartheid pass laws for black women in 1952.
events.subtitle: Women's March (South Africa)
events.headline: 20,000 Women March in Pretoria Against Apartheid Pass Laws

events.originalText: About 20,000 women marched on Pretoria, South Africa, to protest the introduction of pass laws for black women under apartheid.
events.subtitle: Women's March (South Africa)
events.headline: 20,000 Women Protest Apartheid Pass Laws in Pretoria

events.originalText: World War II: The USAAF bomber Bockscar dropped a Fat Man atomic bomb (replica pictured) on Nagasaki, Japan.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: USAAF Bomber Drops Atomic Bomb on Nagasaki, Japan

events.originalText: The United States Forest Service authorized the use of Smokey Bear as its mascot to replace Bambi.
events.subtitle: United States Forest Service
events.headline: Smokey Bear Authorized as Mascot by US Forest Service

events.originalText: World War II: In the first major naval engagement of the Guadalcanal campaign, Japan forced the U.S. Navy to withdraw from the Solomon Islands.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: Japan Forces US Navy to Withdraw from Solomon Islands

events.originalText: Shostakovich's Symphony No. 7 was premiered in Leningrad while the city was under siege by Nazi forces.
events.subtitle: Leningrad première of Shostakovich's Symphony No. 7
events.headline: Shostakovich's Symphony No. 7 Premiered in Leningrad During Nazi Siege

events.originalText: The Blue Lotus, the fifth volume of The Adventures of Tintin by the Belgian cartoonist Hergé and noted for its emphasis on countering negative misconceptions of Chinese people, began serialisation.
events.subtitle: The Blue Lotus
events.headline: The Blue Lotus Begins Serialisation in The Adventures of Tintin

events.originalText: In a ceremony at Westminster Abbey, Edward VII and Alexandra were crowned King and Queen of the United Kingdom and the British Dominions, and Emperor and Empress of India.
events.subtitle: Coronation of Edward VII and Alexandra
events.headline: Edward VII and Alexandra Crowned King and Queen of UK at Westminster Abbey

events.originalText: The first meeting of the International Congress of Mathematicians was held in Zürich, Switzerland.
events.subtitle: International Congress of Mathematicians
events.headline: First International Congress of Mathematicians Held in Zürich

events.originalText: Nez Perce War: Both the Nez Perce and the United States Army suffered numerous casualties at the Battle of the Big Hole, which ended inconclusively.
events.subtitle: Nez Perce War
events.headline: Nez Perce War: Battle of the Big Hole Ends Inconclusively with Numerous Casualties

events.originalText: American Civil War: After nearly being driven from the field in the early part of the Battle of Cedar Mountain, Confederate troops counter-attacked and achieved a victory.
events.subtitle: American Civil War
events.headline: Confederate Troops Achieve Victory at Battle of Cedar Mountain
